solution_04_inferential_statistics/05_exam4/02_one_prop_ci_pval_v2

By hand, this is easiest to do with a normal approximation without the continuity correction.

\[n = 104\] \[\hat{p} = 0.4327\] \[z^\star = 1.96 \] \[\text{CI}_\text{boundaries} = \hat{p} \pm z^\star\sqrt{\frac{\hat{p}(1-\hat{p})}{n}} \] \[\text{CI}_\text{boundaries} = (0.3374701,0.5279145)\] \[z = \frac{\hat{p}-p_0}{\sqrt{p_0(1-p_0)/n}} = 2.7053821\]

\[p\text{-value} = P\left(|Z|>2.7053821\right) = 0.0068226\]


  1. Normal approx: \(0.3374701\). Wilson: \(0.34155\). Wilson with CC: \(0.3370367\). Exact Clopper-Pearson: \(0.3358519\).
  2. Normal approx: \(0.5279145\). Wilson: \(0.5286298\). Wilson with CC: \(0.5333807\). Exact Clopper-Pearson: \(0.5334663\).
  3. Normal approx: \(0.0068226\). Chi squared: \(0.0068226\). Chi squared with CC: \(0.0093395\). Exact: \(0.0080146\).
  4. The p-value is less than 0.05, so the difference is significant. /
